intro: Pedicularis densispica, commonly known as the dense-spiked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
